intro: Stigmaphyllon coloratum, commonly known as the golden stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is often found in conservation areas.
